After installing a terminal open the application and type:
 
 shell@localhost$ su
 shell@localhost# debkit mount
 shell@localhost# debkit chroot
 
 And when done and not planning of using chroot for a while just do:
 
 shell@localhost$ su
 shell@localhost# debkit umount
 
 [!]You can mount or enable the automatic mount option in this App so you can skip the 'debkit mount' step.
 [!]Also available are the Mount and Umount commands from the App menu instead of typing it in the terminal.
 [!]Don't forget to 'debkit umount' before uninstalling the App or re-installing the chroot image, else you will have to manually umount and remove the data directory.
 [!]Use Fix from the App menu to reset the symlink to debkit if the command is not working anymore in a terminal.
